sen.j: 入鹿神社（いるかじんじゃ）は、奈良県橿原市小綱町（しょうこちょう）にある神社である。
sen.e: Iruka-jinja Shrine is located in Shoko-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.
Iruka-jinja Shrine is located in Shoko-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.
Iruka-jinja Shrine is located in Shoko-cho, Kashihara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 別名宗我都比古神社とも言う。
sen.e: Another name is Sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine.
Another name is Sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine.
Another name is Sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 蘇我入鹿とスサノオを祀る。
sen.e: It enshrines SOGA no Iruka and Susanoo.
It enshrines SOGA no Iruka and Susanoo.
It enshrines SOGA no Iruka and Susanoo.

sen.j: スサノオは明治時代より祀られたものである。
sen.e: Susanoo has been enshrined since the Meiji period.
Susanoo has been enshrined since the Meiji period.
Susanoo has been enshrined since the Meiji period.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 蘇我入鹿の木造坐像を神体とする。
sen.e: Its shintai (an object of worship believed to contain the spirit of a deity) is a seated wooden statue of SOGA no Iruka.
Its shintai (an object of worship believed to contain the spirit of a deity) is a seated wooden statue of SOGA no Iruka.
Its shintai (an object of worship believed to contain the spirit of a deity) is a seated wooden statue of SOGA no Iruka.

sen.j: 現在の橿原市周辺は蘇我氏ゆかりの地であり、「蘇我」、「曽我」といった地名も残る。
sen.e: The place around present-day Kashihara City is in connection with the SOGA clan and there are the name of places such as 'soga' (蘇我) and 'soga' (曽我).
The place around present-day Kashihara City has connections with the SOGA clan and there are place names such as 'soga' (蘇我) and 'soga' (曽我).
The place around present-day Kashihara City has connections with the SOGA clan and there are place names such as 'soga' (蘇我) and 'soga' (曽我).

sen.j: 小綱町の隣の曽我町には、蘇我馬子が創建した宗我都比古神社があり、蘇我氏の始祖を祀っている。
sen.e: Sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine which was build by SOGA no Umako and enshrines the founder of the SOGA clan was in Soga-cho, next to Shoko-cho.
Sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine, which was built by SOGA no Umako and enshrines the founder of the SOGA clan, was in Soga-cho, next to Shoko-cho.
Sogatsuhiko-jinja Shrine, which was built by SOGA no Umako and enshrines the founder of the SOGA clan, was in Soga-cho, next to Shoko-cho.

sen.j: 明治時代に、政府は皇国史観に基づいて逆臣である蘇我入鹿を神として祀るのは都合が悪いとした。
sen.e: During the Meiji period, under the view of Kokokushikan (historical view to put the Imperial family in the center of the Japanese history), the government insisted it was inappropriate that SOGA no Iruka, who was a traitor, was enshrined as a god.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 原文を2分割したので、主語として「政府は」を追加しました。
sen.e: During the Meiji period, under the view of Kokokushikan (historical view to put the Imperial family in the center of the Japanese history), the government insisted it was inappropriate that SOGA no Iruka, who was a traitor, was enshrined as a god.

During the Meiji period, under the view of Kokokushikan (historical view to put the Imperial family in the center of the Japanese history), the government insisted it was inappropriate that SOGA no Iruka, who was a traitor, was enshrined as a god.

sen.j: そのため、祭神をスサノオに、社名を地名からとった「小綱神社」に改めるように言ったが、地元住民はそれを拒んだという。
sen.e: Therefore, the government proposed that enshrined god should be changed to Susanoo and the name of the shrine should be renamed 'Shoko-jinja Shrine' after the name of the place, but local residents rejected it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「言われた」→「言った」に変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore, the government proposed that enshrined god should be changed to Susanoo and the name of the shrine should be renamed 'Shoko-jinja Shrine' after the name of the place, but local residents rejected it.

Therefore, the government proposed that enshrined god should be changed to Susanoo and the name of the shrine should be renamed 'Shoko-jinja Shrine' after the name of the place, but local residents rejected it.

sen.j: 日本書紀に基づいた「蘇我氏逆臣説」が日本史に通説となっている今に至るまで、地元の人々から崇敬を集めている。
sen.e: Nowadays, 'the theory of the rebels, the SOGA clan' based on Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) is commonly accepted in the history of Japanese, but even so, to this day, the shrine has received veneration from the local residents.

Nowadays, 'the theory of the rebels, the SOGA clan' based on Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) is commonly accepted in Japanese history, but even so, to this day, the shrine has received veneration from the local residents.

Nowadays, 'the theory of the rebels, the SOGA clan' based on Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) is commonly accepted in Japanese history, but even so, to this day, the shrine has received veneration from the local residents.

sen.j: 境内には神宮寺としてかつて仏起山普賢寺があり大日如来が祀られていた。
sen.e: In its precincts, Buttkizan Fugen-ji Temple was built as Jingu-ji Temple and it enshrined Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).
sen.cmt: 仏起山普賢寺の読み方不明のため、Buttkizan Fugen-ji Templeとしました。
sen.e: In its precincts, Buttkizan Fugen-ji Temple was built as Jingu-ji Temple and it enshrined Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).
In its precincts, Buttkizan Fugen-ji Temple was built as Jingu-ji Temple and it enshrined Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).

sen.j: 廃仏毀釈の際に普賢寺は廃寺となった。
sen.e: During Haibutsu kishaku (historic movements of abolishing Buddhism and destroying Buddhist temples and images), Fugen-ji Temple was abolished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During Haibutsu kishaku (historic movements of abolishing Buddhism and destroying Buddhist temples and images), Fugen-ji Temple was abolished.
During Haibutsu kishaku (historic movements of abolishing Buddhism and destroying Buddhist temples and images), Fugen-ji Temple was abolished.

sen.j: しかし、建物と本尊の仏像は残されて成等山正蓮寺の管理となり、「大日堂」という名称で現存している。
sen.e: However, the buildings and the principal icon of Buddhist temple were left and maintained by Joto-zan Shorenji -Temple and exist as the name of 'Dainichi-do'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the buildings and the principal icon of the Buddhist temple were left and maintained by Joto-zan Shorenji-Temple and exist as the name of 'Dainichi-do'.
However, the buildings and the principal icon of the Buddhist temple were left and maintained by Joto-zan Shorenji-Temple and exist as the name of 'Dainichi-do.'

sen.j: 大日堂および大日如来木像は国の重要文化財になっている。
sen.e: Dainichi-do and the wooden statue of Dainichi Nyorai are National important cultural assets.
Dainichi-do and the wooden statue of Dainichi Nyorai are National important cultural assets.
Dainichi-do and the wooden statue of Dainichi Nyorai are National important cultural assets.
